# hide()

**Type Method**

Makes the current cursor invisible.

## Declaration

```swift
class func hide()
```

## Discussion

If another cursor becomes current, that cursor will be invisible, too. It will remain invisible until you invoke the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCursor/unhide()] method.

Each invocation of `hide` must be balanced by an invocation of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCursor/unhide()] in order for the cursor to be displayed.

The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCursor/hide()] method overrides [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCursor/setHiddenUntilMouseMoves(_:)].

## Setting cursor attributes

- **image**: The cursor’s image.
- **hotSpot**: The position of the click location within the cursor.
- **unhide()**: Negates an earlier call to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCursor/hide()] by showing the current cursor.
- **setHiddenUntilMouseMoves(_:)**: Sets whether the cursor is hidden until the mouse moves.
